content.description: Mostly finger crack with plenty of face holds. Crux is the start. Feel free to supplement bolts with gear.
content.location:
Left (South) of

Schooled.

First bolt is orange/tan.

content.description:
Crux starts right off the ground!! Fire and run place and go thing is hard start to end! Great gear!! Get on it

Located a column and a half to the left of "Nothing But Jam"
content.protection: 2bolt anchor small medium wires to micro cams .2- .5

content.description: Either by layback or the face, ascend an interesting column.
content.protection: 6 Bolts, anchor is off to the right atop another column.
content.location: Obvious blown out block to the left and a very sharp arete with bolts. Towards the middle of the formation.

content.description: 8 Bolts, up the blunt arete, dancing between shallow seams. Unfortunately missing the 2nd or 3rd hanger...

Start in a wide stem and shimmy up to twin cracks and an assortment of moves. Crux is about the third bolt where the right crack is just enough to get through (or jam straight up the left crack). Most of the route is 5.8ish.
content.protection: 8 bolts. You could place finger size gear but it isn't necessary. Anchor is 1 chain and 1 shut.
content.location:
Twin seam route that starts where the left pillar base is blown out. Left (South) of

Beauty and the Beast

.

content.description: Follow the thin hand crack, or optional finer crack off to the right, up and over onto an ledge. Use the arete off to the left to keep it 5.9. The crux is the first or the last move..
content.protection: 2 1/2 inch gear and below. Save something small for the finish. Anchors are  1 chain and 1 shut. Guidebook mentioned one bolt, but I didn't find it.

content.description:
Follows a thin finger crack up a nice corner with face holds, then through a wide corner. Crux was right before the fourth bolt where smearing is required. Rock is surprisingly solid.

Could possibly be lead as a trad line, or mixed at the least.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Anchor is 1 chain and 1 shut.
content.location: First Route all the way on the right (North) end of the wall. These is a stubby tree right underneath of it.

content.description:
Splitter that starts as a wide crack (#3), then quickly constricts to mostly .75 - 1 friends for 40 feet.

Crack is flakey but pro holds well. Will clean up fast with traffic.
content.location: Just left of Who's Fooling Whom.

content.description: Climbs slightly better than it looks. This climbs the crack in the left facing corner just to the right of the unknown finger / tight hand crack that has a bolt off the ground.
content.protection: Standard rack with extra 1s and 2s, one bolt on the right side of crack before anchors
content.location: Next crack to the left of Sweet Loretta Modern

content.description: Move into the hand size crack, and either climb it or the various jugs on the arete. Crack starts at about a #2 friend and get progressively  wider to a #4 friend near the top. Crux is mounting the ledge near the anchor.
content.protection: Single #2 friend, double # 3 friend, and optional #4. Anchors are 1 chain and 1 shut.
content.location:
Thee cracks left (South) of

Painted Harlot

.

content.description: 3 bolts + some supplemental hand sized gear if you'd like! Fun chimney.
content.protection: 3 Bolts + Gear. Anchors on top of free standing pillar
content.location: Obvious bolted chimney 15 feet left of Get Down.

content.description: Start at a bolt with excellent twin finger locks on each side and worm your way up the stembox to an off-width right side and a bolt. Pick your poison to finish..
content.protection: #.75 Friend and below, medium nuts, 2 bolts. You could fit in something big in the flaring off-width on the right, but the left crack is sufficient. Anchor is 1 chain and 1 shut.
